CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant worked as chief physician in a hospital managed by the GPE patriarchate . On DATE the applicant on her own initiative left her place of work in order to participate in a conference dedicated to the fight against drug addiction in GPE , organised by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was dismissed for unjustified absence from work on DATE . She believed that the dismissal was unlawful and brought civil proceedings for reinstatement and for compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Simonovskiy ORG of GPE partly allowed the claims , ordered her reinstatement and awarded her MONEY ( RUB ) in respect of pecuniary damage . The applicant ’s claims for non - pecuniary damage were dismissed . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgment . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and the appeal decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for a fresh examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Simonovskiy District Court of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s claims in full . ORG upheld the judgment on DATE .
CARDINAL . The Vice - President of ORG lodged an application for supervisory review of the ruling of the ORG of ORG of DATE and the subsequent judgments .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by way of supervisory review , quashed the ruling of DATE and the judgment of DATE and restored the validity of the judgment of CARDINAL March and the appeal decision of CARDINAL DATE as regards the applicant ’s reinstatement and the refusal to pay her compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The applicant ’s pecuniary claims were remitted to the first - instance court for a fresh examination as the amount initially awarded had by that time considerably decreased in purchasing power . No appeal lay against this ruling .
CARDINAL . The Prosecutor General ’s Office lodged an application for supervisory review of ORG ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of DATE by way of supervisory review and restored the validity of the judgment of DATE , upheld on appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . For the relevant provisions on the supervisory review proceedings contained in DATE , see the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IX ) .
